photos.description:
Shot this photo during a shoot featuring a group of guys drinkin and tinkerin with trucks while they are between jobs in Upstate NY.



This photograph is part of a series where I investigate the state of the American Dream during the recession.

photos.name: 4pm at torrance beach
photos.description: A boy clinches his towel, still dripping from a swim in the ocean. He looks at the water, giving one good stare before his family gets in the car to go home. A woman perks her head up out of a book she's reading on a grassy knoll. The harsh diagonals created by the walkway on the left drive the eye to the beach that recedes into the background on yet another diagonal ending in the entire coast of Los Angeles County on a virtually smog free day. The mountains of Malibu sit nestled on the upper third of the photo. Shot at f/16, the Canon EF 17-40mm f/4L USM doesn't hold back on sharpness at 19mm, almost hit the sweet spot from 20-24mm for this lens. HDR processing in Photoshop.

photos.name: Fixing A Bike
photos.description: Summers in Upstate NY are always a great time, especially at this farm in Poestenskill. Broken down bikes, cars and trucks and strewn all over the property, set aside a beautiful patch of forest. The kids are fun to photograph, they are always outside doing something interesting like this one here who is fixing up his bikes. One time I caught him chopping wood too.

photos.name: Watching TV
photos.description: Self Portrait of myself watching TV. Thought the texture of the static compared to the out of focus head was nice.

photos.name: Cookie Cutter
photos.description:
Newly built homes waiting silently for new owners in the middle of the recession. Shot in Lansingburgh, NY. Part of a series of photographs concerned with the state of the American Dream during the last recession. 

5 Shot HDR, processed in Photoshop.

photos.name: Big Box
photos.description:
This photo is part of a series of images where I am documenting the state of the American Dream in American during the latest recession. I shot this at a vacant Bog Box store somewhere in Arizona while driving cross country. This particular photo is probably a familiar scene in many rural communities in the U.S.A. Sometimes people repurpose these structures into community centers, churches, art centers, but this one was vacant when I happened upon it. I thought it was odd a light was missing.

3 shot HDR shot shot on a tripod w/ Canon 7D, processed in Camera Raw to remove distortion from 17-40mm f/4L, then Merge to HDR Pro and that was it. I like the color contrast and detail in the structure, and the overall tone of the lighting. What do you like about it?

This photo has been recently reprocessed for a submission to an exhibition.

photos.name: West Taghkanic Diner
photos.description: We stopped in at the gas station next door while driving down the Taconic State Parkway to New York City. The lighting was great so I jumped out of the car and grabbed a shot of this classic greek style Diner called West Taghkanic Diner. If they were open I would have stopped in to grab a slice of pie.

photos.name: Construction Site
photos.description: This is another shot I'm considering for my series about the American Dream.

photos.name: Praise Waiteth for Thee O God in Zion
photos.description: A deserted church in the middle of nowhere in California.

photos.name: The Hearth Of The Home
photos.description: Taken in an abandoned home in Bombay Beach, CA. This town is on the edge of the polluted and salty Saltan Sea and sits right on the San Andreas fault. The town is protected by a dike that sometimes doesn't work and floods part of the town. There are people who live here, in the middle of nowhere about a hour drive outside of Palm Springs.

photos.name: Living Spaces
photos.description: This photo is part of a series of works about the American Dream. Houses in this spanish modern style dot the desert landscape in California. Close to the highway, these neighborhood provide easy access to the highway for commuters to Los Angeles. Eventhough these homes are in the of the desert, some feature lush green lawns which require a lot of watering to stay green. The developer of these homes in the country chose to build them so close together, as to not give the owners a decent lawn.

photos.name: On The Edge Of Suburbia
photos.description: The foothills leading up to the Angeles National Forest are being encroached on by suburbia. Why do people have to lay sod down and ruin the native habitat that is beautiful on it's own? What is with these Southern Californians having to conquer nature by growing a green lawn, pumping water into an ecosystem that was never meant to sip on its sweet nectar? Some towns feature lavish water fountains in the center of town. Who really thinks this is a good idea?

photos.name: All American Lady
photos.description:
This photo of an elderly lady near Troy, NY shows the pride the members of the Greatest Generation there have in being American. On an adjacent wall (not pictured) hangs photos of all her brothers who served in the Navy during World War II and Korea. Troy maintains the honor of being the burial place of Samuel Wilson, the man who was the inspiration for Uncle Sam. A statue of Uncle Sam sits behind the lady, a couple flags like one who might wave at a parade above her, a collection of red, white and blue baskets in the background.

I spent the holidays trying out a new lens and boy am I impressed by the versatility of the 16-35mm f/4L IS USM. It is a huge upgrade from the 17-40mm f/4L USM I was shooting with, however that IS adds some weight. The shots I release over the next week will all be samples from this new lens.

photos.name: Watching TV
photos.description: Self Portrait of myself watching TV. Thought the texture of the static compared to the out of focus head was nice.

photos.name: Thanksgiving Dinner
photos.description:
Portrait of a young man who is taking the buns out of the oven. Taken during the couple's first Thanksgiving Dinner together in their new home.

First in a series of photographs where I document Americans living through the recession and finding the American Dream. Taken right outside of Troy, NY in the Albany Capital Region.

photos.name: Blue Collar, No Collar
photos.description: This photo was taken in Schaghticoke, NY. Part of a series where I document Americans living through the recession.

photos.name: Broke Down
photos.description:
Shot this photo during a shoot featuring a group of guys drinkin and tinkerin with trucks while they are between jobs in Upstate NY.



This photograph is part of a series where I investigate the state of the American Dream during the recession.

photos.name: Fixing A Bike
photos.description: Summers in Upstate NY are always a great time, especially at this farm in Poestenskill. Broken down bikes, cars and trucks and strewn all over the property, set aside a beautiful patch of forest. The kids are fun to photograph, they are always outside doing something interesting like this one here who is fixing up his bikes. One time I caught him chopping wood too.

photos.name: Thumbs Up!
photos.description: Summers in Upstate NY are always a great time. We try to schedule the trip when the entire family is truckin it down to the Jah Train for an evening of reggae and fun times. Caught this shot of Forrest here, giving the thumbs up to everyone in the van while we were stopped for gas.

photos.name: Disconnection Notice
photos.description:
Shot this while out shooting the remains of the Erie Canal with Jared Landburg and Guy Carlo. Guy is sitting on a chair that was dumped there, staring into his iPhone. Photographed somewhere in Central NY in summertime. 

1 Exposure Processed with HDR Toning in Photoshop.

photos.name: Anywhere, America
photos.description:
The parking lots of strip malls are pretty much empty, big box stores abandoned. The last grocery store may be going out of business. The triple steakburger is 3.99. It's good to be alive.

This photo is part of a series where I document people living in America during the recession. Shot somewhere in Illinois off an exit on Rt. 70.

photos.name: The Last Sun of 2012
photos.description:
Happy New Year!

I thought this shot would be appropriate for the last sunset of 2012. People were scared the world was going to end on the turning of the Mayan Calendar, so I wanted this shot to reflect the sense of a monolithic calendar formed by the pillars. I might study the movement of the sun through the pillars as the seasons change in 2013, try to get that sun in the center one day. This probably won't be the last shot of sunset at the pier.

 This was shot in Manhattan Beach below the pier on Dec 31st, 2012. 3 shot handheld HDR, +-3EV I think. Happy New Year everyone!

photos.name: New Years Stroll on Manhattan Beach Pier
photos.description: Couples walking on Manhattan Beach Pier before sunset. Christmas decorations still up, the holiday season is almost over. New Years Eve on Manhattan Beach Pier. 3 shot handheld HDR, 3EV+- with Canon 7D.

photos.name: Sunset at Honeymoon Cove
photos.description:
Sunset in Palos Verdes Estates in one of the more isolated coves, Honeymoon Cove. I thought the sunset was over, so I packed up my gear and turned around after hiking a bit to find the sun had lit up the sky again. Captured this along the trail among the beautiful volcanic rocks. I want to go back and find some different rocks that were from lava flows, because they looked amazing during sunset.

The last upload was cropped slightly differently in Photoshop, as to allow a silver of negative space on the bottom of the frame.

photos.name: After A Satisfying Dive
photos.description: A diver collects his thoughts while gazing on the beautiful sunset in Redondo Beach, CA. Shot using Canon 7D with 3 exposure HDR, 2EV+- processing in Photoshop Camera Raw and HDR Pro.

photos.name: Graffiti Sunset
photos.description: Walking through Venice Beach, I caught this shot of a man admiring the graffiti walls on the beach. Venice Beach is a colorful town and tonight so was the sunset. Shot during the sunset at its peak, HDR +-2EV using Canon 7D.

photos.name: Palos Verdes Sunset
photos.description:
Just after sunset, the rocks in the Palos Verdes Pennisula turn magnificent purples, blues, and reds. These are heavily eroded volcanic rocks. Beautiful boulders to climb around on. 

3 Shot HDR, tripod. 

Just after sunset at in a cove in Rancho Palos Verdes, CA just south of Los Angeles.

photos.name: Biking Into The Sunset
photos.description:
I sped on my bike to Manhattan Beach on a weekend night to catch this sunset. There was a production going on underneath the pier where a lot of people shoot. This time of the year the sun sets over Malibu. This sunset is also typical of those after the June Gloom, as the marine layer begins to break up over the South Bay. This photo is part of a series of photos where I capture moments in the Beach Cities of Los Angeles. 

I like the out of focus motion of the couple biking, the sunset and clouds are epic for this time of year and the over tone is pleasing. I really like this shot. There are more shots of the Beach Cities in my Sets. 

Shot with a Canon 7D, 3 exposure handheld HDR processed in Camera Raw -> Merge to HDR Pro -> Camera Raw Filter -> Export to JPEG.

photos.name: Twilight on the Pennisula
photos.description: Just after sunset on Palos Verdes Pennisula. Jagged rocks, rocked by volcanic activity are now eroded away by natural forces. At twilight, the volcanic rocks turn all sorts of beautiful colors. Catalina Island sits off in the distance, while the southern tip of Palos Verdes Pennisula jets out into the top left of the frame.

photos.name: Country Gold II
photos.description:
I decided to take the scenic route one afternoon and found this sunset in my rear view mirror. The countryside in Upstate New York is filled with rolling hills and farmlands. In the foothills of the Adirondacks, scenes like these can be viewed in the humid summer evening. Other shots had better crops, but this wide angle had the best sunburst and atmosphere in my opinion.

5 shot HDR, processed in PS HDR Pro. Uploaded again with different toning and processing, nicer composition. Looks more natural.

photos.name: Stray Sunset
photos.description:
I was out shooting this sunset at an overlook by Malaga Cove in Palos Verdes Estates, CA when this stray black kitten wandered by. He didn't actually cross my path and was very approachable, although I didn;t touch him. This was a very hungry kitten, I caught him stalking a Hummingbird. We wanted to save him, but can't! Please help this kitty!

This is a single exposure, processed in Photoshop Camera Raw, removed some noise from shooting at 1250 ISO, focus at infinity.

photos.name: There's Always Sun After the Rain
photos.description:
The cloudy skies broke at at the horizon on this day in Redondo Beach, offering this beautiful show of twilight colors. 

3 Shot HDR, processed 2 different ways and blended. I might do this technique for all the dark cloudy skies in my photos if ya'll like it.

photos.name: The Eye Of God
photos.description: This is the first sunset I photographed in California after our road trip from the East Coast. Taken from the balcony of our hotel, I couldn't find a pleasing foreground so I popped open the telephoto and caught this shot of the sun near the horizon, ducking behind some beautiful clouds. It was very inspirational for me at the time.

photos.name: Sunset on Sunset
photos.description:
Sunset on Sunset Blvd. is magical sometimes. The old motel signs harken back to the days when this road was the end of the famous Route 66. 

Caught this shot while heading into a restaurant on Sunset Blvd. in Hollywood, CA. The perspective of the street and the lighting caught my eye. wish the woman walking had better movement and she does in the HDR, but this processed version of one of the shots came out way better.

photos.name: CAUTION: DO NOT ENTER
photos.description: Ran down to the beach at sunset and caught this shot on Memorial Day.

photos.name: Golden Cove
photos.description:
This golden sunset lit up a band of clouds, the shimmering low tide reflecting the beautiful color of the bright California sky.

Shot at Lunada Bay in Rancho Palos Verdes. 3 shot HDR, processed in Photoshop.

photos.name: Beach Days Gone By
photos.description: This one is unique and it almost stands alone from the series . There is a completely abstracted shot, but I really liked how the sllhouettes in this one turned out. I had beautiful light to work with that evening in Redondo Beach.

photos.name: Twilight On The Edge Of The World
photos.description: Caught this shot of a California Sunset off the edge of a cliff on the Palos Verdes Peninsula, just south of Redondo Beach.

photos.name: Summer's End In Hermosa Beach
photos.description: The last sunset of the summer for most people. Labor Day is just a week away, but the kids are already back to school. The clouds parted for this clear sunset on a late August evening underneath Hermosa Beach Pier in Hermosa Beach, CA.

photos.name: Paddleboarding In Hermosa Beach At Dusk
photos.description:
Caught this shot one summer night in Hermosa Beach, CA right after shooting the pier at sunset. Behind me a concert is finishing up and the beach is packed with people, a few couples linger on the Pier, and a lone Paddleboarder watches the sunset. I like how the details on his board shorts pop, eventhough it seems somewhat unnatural.

 2EV+-HDR, Processed in Camera Raw then Curves Adjustment in Photoshop CC.

photos.name: Firefighters Racing To Redondo Beach Pier
photos.description: Caught this shot out of nowhere while walking down to the pier in Redondo Beach one evening.

photos.name: Vintage Cali
photos.description: Shot on the coast in Northern California. After editing in Photoshop CC it felt vintage to me. Considering moving over to Lightroom because the app is coming out for iPad, but really dig my current workflow in Photoshop CC so I may not abandon it just yet.

photos.name: Sailing At Sunset In The South Bay
photos.description: Captured this shot of a small sailboat pulling into the King Harbor Marina during an exquisite sunset here in Redondo Beach, CA. I just launched a new photo portfolio that I also developed at kineticlight.co. It will replace my 500px portfolio after my Awesome account expires. I really did not appreciate when 500px took down my portfolio after messaging only 5 of my followers links to my Kickstarter for my exhibition. They said I was spamming, which is not true. So I created this new website, that I hope you will visit and enjoy the experience on an iPad or iPhone. I can create photo portfolios for you too for a reasonable price. There will be a short break from abstract photography on my profile.

photos.name: Sunset In Redondo Beach
photos.description: Sunset in Redondo Beach, CA one January evening in 2014.

photos.name: One January Evening Off The Coast Of California
photos.description: Just as the title says, one evening this January the Santa Ana winds swept some clouds over the ocean.

photos.name: Warehouse District At Dusk
photos.description: Captured this HDR somewhere off the 10 in Southern California right before we ate some delicious Mexican food. I like the details in the backlit wire, both electrical and barbed.

photos.name: Lifeguard Off Duty
photos.description: A lifeguard in Redondo Beach, CA goes off duty, pictured here collecting the flags dispersed on the sand. The sun sets over the Pacific Ocean, retreating over the horizon to signal the end of another November day on the coast of California.

photos.name: That Last Glimpse Of Sunlight Is An Illusion
photos.description: Caught this fiery sunset in Redondo Beach, CA.

photos.name: The Sky Is Burning!
photos.description: A sunset in Redondo Beach, CA in December. This is a great time of year to watch the sunset in Southern California.

photos.name: Sailing Into The Inferno
photos.description: A lone sail boat sits still on the horizon, birds flying in the sky at the end of this glorious sunset off the coast of California.

photos.name: Running Into The Sunset
photos.description: A group of kids running through the frame of this sunset shot during the end of a beautiful December day in Redondo Beach, California. The Palos Verdes Peninsula stretches along the horizon into the burning embers of the sunset. I thought my 17-40mm f/4L was getting long in the tooth, but it is still pumping out some amazing shots.

photos.name: An Icon By Accident
photos.description: The title is a play on words. The stars on this barn are mimicked on other homes on this stretch of road miles away from Deep Creek Lake in the town of Accident, Maryland. The sunset always dips below the mountain here, however this evening the sunlight spoked through some looming clouds that promised snow. This town in Garret County gets a disproportionate amount of snow compared to the rest of the state of Maryland. Incidentally, fog roams through these hills that are nestled in the middle of the Appalachian Mountains. It's funny to me "Accident" isn't even on the map.

photos.name: The Rain Is Gone
photos.description: The much needed rain was a non stop this past weekend until sunday evening when the sky opened up to reveal this beautiful sunset in Redondo Beach, California.

photos.name: Greetings From Redondo Beach
photos.description:
Redondo Beach Pier on a Saturday in January. It was a nice sunny day today, bringing people down to Redondo Beach.

I wish Canon and other camera manufacturers would offer firmware upgrades with meaningful feature updates. At least for Canon users there is Magic Lantern. Today I turned on the Dual ISO module. ML directs the camera to take one shot where half the photo is ISO 100 and another is ISO 1600 for instance. The photo looks like it has scanlines before being processed in the cr2hdr app. Afterward, I brought the DNG created by the cr2hdr app into Camera Raw and process it further. The dynamic range is fantastic without having to postprocess in HDR. Often when putting shots of waves through a HDR process, ghosting is out of control resulting in strange fragments and noise. Dual ISO is a viable alternative to HDR, but the cr2hdr app is prone to create moire and noise in some instances so take multiple shots if you want to make sure you have a good one.

photos.name: Arizona
photos.description:
Caught this shot somewhere off the Interstate on a mountain road in Arizona. 

There's another color processed photo called "Desert Bliss" in my profile, but this B+W  really highlights the more interesting parts of this landscape.

photos.description:
Just after sunset, the rocks in the Palos Verdes Pennisula turn magnificent purples, blues, and reds. These are heavily eroded volcanic rocks. Beautiful boulders to climb around on. 

3 Shot HDR, tripod. 

Just after sunset at in a cove in Rancho Palos Verdes, CA just south of Los Angeles.

photos.name: Anywhere, America II
photos.description: This photo is part of a series where I take a look at the state of the American Dream during the recession.

photos.name: Malaga Cove After The Storm
photos.description: Caught this shot in Malaga Cove when I was walkin down the trail to surf. A bit overprocessed for my taste, but its shots like these that take HDR processing really well. This photo is part of a series where I document the beach cities I live in.

photos.name: Half Dome in the Distance
photos.description: While driving through Yosemite, I caught this shot of Half Dome from one of the parking areas. Planning a return trip to explore Yosemite in detail in 2013.

photos.name: Cathedral Gorge
photos.description: Melting snow on the rim of Cathedral Gorge in Southeastern Nevada.

photos.name: Thank You, Pioche
photos.description: Sun setting on the ole mining town Pioche, also the county seat of Lincoln County in Southeastern, Nevada.

photos.name: Cathedral Gorge State Park
photos.description:
Shot while on a hike in Cathedral Gorge State Park in NV.  3 shot HDR converted to B+W in CS6.

Thank you everyone for you support! Vote and fav my photos and I usually return the favor.

photos.name: Erosion
photos.description:
Shot while on a hike in Cathedral Gorge State Park in NV.  3 shot HDR converted to B+W in CS6.

Thank you everyone for you support! Vote and fav my photos and I usually return the favor.

photos.name: The Gate
photos.description: The Gate to the Garden of the Gods, taken during my second trip to the park on a wonderfully cloudy day. This place has been photographed tons of times, so I hope this is a fresh take. I can imagine a God behind the Gate, with all the dark clouds looming in the sky behind the gate.

photos.name: Rocky Mountain Twilight
photos.description: Taken somewhere off the side of a mountain road in Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado.

photos.name: Rocky Mountain Crescent
photos.description: Taken somewhere off the side of a mountain road in Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado. I like this horizontal composition, especially with the crescent moon.

photos.name: The Desert Road Is My Home
photos.description: The open road of the desert in front of me, twisting and turning through the mountains before it comes to an endless expanse of desert flat. Taken somewhere in New Mexico, 3 shot HDR.

photos.name: Arizona
photos.description: Shot this on a coast to coast road trip off the highway and back a ways.

photos.name: Winter's Run
photos.description:
In summertime, the Los Angeles River is most dried up. Winter is a completely different story, where earthen bottom portions of the River become teaming with life. Most of the LA River is a hude concrete slab. Here, runoff water from the Los Angeles mountains makes it's final stretch into the Pacific. 

Birds bathe in this section of the L.A. River, as shot heading South from the Sepulveda Blvd. bridge. The Long Beach skyline is in the distance to the left, the Port of L.A. to the right. 

3 shot HDR, saturated and slight curves in Photoshop.

photos.name: There's Always Sun After the Rain
photos.description:
The cloudy skies broke at at the horizon on this day in Redondo Beach, offering this beautiful show of twilight colors. 

3 Shot HDR, processed 2 different ways and blended. I might do this technique for all the dark cloudy skies in my photos if ya'll like it.

photos.name: Golden Cove
photos.description:
This golden sunset lit up a band of clouds, the shimmering low tide reflecting the beautiful color of the bright California sky.

Shot at Lunada Bay in Rancho Palos Verdes. 3 shot HDR, processed in Photoshop.

photos.name: Sailing Out Of The Marina
photos.description:
Two sailboats pick up the strong winds on a Sunday afternoon in the King Harbor Marina in Redondo Beach, CA. Animals crowd the jetty, sunbathing on the rocks while the clouds move quickly above.

Single shot, processed with HDR in Photoshop and blended with original.

photos.name: Flowers Off The Angeles Crest Highway
photos.description: Caught this shot of some wildflowers on the side of a trail connecting two parking areas on the Angeles Crest Highway. It's summertime in Southern California and June Gloom has set in on the coast, so we decided this morning we needed some fresh mountain air. The lighting was flat most of the day, except for areas partially lit by some sunlight cutting through the tree line.

photos.name: Big Box
photos.description:
This photo is part of a series of images where I am documenting the state of the American Dream in American during the latest recession. I shot this at a vacant Bog Box store somewhere in Arizona while driving cross country. This particular photo is probably a familiar scene in many rural communities in the U.S.A. Sometimes people repurpose these structures into community centers, churches, art centers, but this one was vacant when I happened upon it. I thought it was odd a light was missing.

3 shot HDR shot shot on a tripod w/ Canon 7D, processed in Camera Raw to remove distortion from 17-40mm f/4L, then Merge to HDR Pro and that was it. I like the color contrast and detail in the structure, and the overall tone of the lighting. What do you like about it?

This photo has been recently reprocessed for a submission to an exhibition.

photos.name: Morning On The Farm in California
photos.description: Caught this shot in the early morning on a drive back from San Francisco to Los Angeles, CA somewhere close to Bakersfield, CA.3 shot HDR, processed in Camera Raw, Merge to HDR Pro, Reprocessed in Camera Raw and output to Progressive JPEG.

photos.name: Running On The Beach In San Francisco
photos.description: On a recent trip we dropped into San Francisco for a day, went to Baker Beach for part of the late afternoon. Caught this shot of other people enjoying the beach with the Golden Gate Bridge in the background. I was fortunate to have some amazing lighting as the sun dropped beneath a hazy mass of clouds. 3 Shot HDR shot handheld with Canon 7D, processed in Camera Raw to remove distortion, Merge to HDR in Photoshop, reprocessed in Camera Raw with the new filter in Photoshop CC to make adjustments post HDR, then exported to JPG. This shot is a lot like a previous beach shot in L.A. I posted almost a year ago called The Dude. The person in the center pops against the perspective created by the beach, the Golden Gate Bridge rests on a third. The shoes reinforce the perspective. I like this one because it works compositionally.

photos.name: The Golden Gate
photos.description:
Caught this shot of the Golden Gate Bridge during a recent trip to San Francisco. We were driving around the coast and noticed the sun hitting the bridge was exquisite so we had to stop and capture a few shots of such an iconic American landmark.

3 shot HDR preprocessed in Camera Raw, Merge to HDR Pro in Photoshop CC, Camera Raw Filter. This is the original crop.

photos.name: Arizona II
photos.description: I'm going through a bunch of archived photos and found this alternative view of some mountains in the desert of Arizona. I got this photo while we were driving cross country with trailer in tow from Syracuse, NY to Los Angeles, CA. It was originally shot in color with 3 exposures +-2EV, processed in Camera Raw and Merge to HDR in Photoshop CS6, corrected some noise and then processed in Black and White Filter Adjustment. I crushed the blacks a bit and thought the contrast was stunning on the rocks and dead desert brush. You can really feel the distance to the mountain via the atmospheric perspective and DOF. I wish I could shoot infrared, sometimes.

photos.name: Autumn In The Cemetery
photos.description: This is where my abstract work bleeds into the landscapes I photograph. Taken while poking around Oakwood Cemetery in Troy, NY during the fall season. This is the original crop, although I flipped the shot vertically so the POV would make sense. This is a photograph of a reflection in one of the ponds in Oakwood Cemetery.

photos.name: Autumn Upstate
photos.description: Taken during a recent trip to Upstate New York in Oakwood Cemetery in Troy, NY. 3 shot HDR.

photos.name: Rexleigh, One Autumn Afternoon
photos.description:
I went for photorealism with this photograph of Rexleigh Covered Bridge found just outside of Cambridge, NY. This 3 shot HDR processed in Photoshop CC and Camera Raw has the closest to the natural lighting as I could remember it. The bridge has a notice painted on it that says "25 Dollars Fine For Driving On This Bridge Faster Than A Walk". It is a classic Upstate New York scene. 

Sitting beside the Rexleigh Bridge, just downstream on the Batten Kill is an abandoned Mill. The locals warned us the dilapidated structure is haunted. It is peculiar that if I would pan left or right outside of the frame, early Autumn color is all over the leaves. Half the trees haven't even turned except for in this patch around the old Mill everything looks dead. Kinda creepy. This photo is the last in a series of four from our visit to Rexleigh, just outside of Cambridge, New York near the border with Vermont.

photos.name: Autumn In Lake Taghkanic State Park
photos.description: On our drive down the Taconic State Parkway in Upstate New York we saw a sign for Lake Taghkanic State Park so we drove in to see what autumn was like at the Lake, which seems like it would be a preferred summertime destination for swimming. I crouched down on the shore to capture the lilypads in the foreground and managed to capture this 3 shot HDR handheld with a Canon 7D. I have a few other angles from this section of lake I will probably post in the next few days.

photos.name: Autumn Color On The Shore Of Lake Taghkanic
photos.description: On our drive down the Taconic State Parkway in Upstate New York we saw a sign for Lake Taghkanic State Park so we drove in to see what autumn was like at the Lake, which seems like it would be a preferred summertime destination for swimming. I crouched down on the shore to capture the lilypads in the foreground and managed to capture this 3 shot HDR handheld with a Canon 7D. I have a few other angles from this section of lake I will probably post in the next few days.

photos.name: Autumn Lake
photos.description: I liked the backlighting on the trees in this shot from Lake Taghkanic State Park in Upstate New York.

photos.name: Vintage Cali
photos.description: Shot on the coast in Northern California. After editing in Photoshop CC it felt vintage to me. Considering moving over to Lightroom because the app is coming out for iPad, but really dig my current workflow in Photoshop CC so I may not abandon it just yet.

photos.name: Waves Crashing On The Pacific Coast
photos.description: Taken in Humboldt County, California during our Christmas break, it was during the last moments of sunset.

photos.name: The Magic Of The Redwoods
photos.description:
There should sometimes be limits on the reach of corporations into our lives. This aspect of Humboldt County is one that I appreciated the most while visiting there. Wal Mart and Home Depot can't get semi trucks through Richardson Grove, one of the largest and densest grove of redwoods that line US 101 in Northern California. These corporations keep lobbying to get the trees cut down in order to widen the road. But then we wouldn't be able to experience magical moments like this one captured a little further down the road in the Avenue of The Giants. Just build a damn bypass that has less impact on the trees. But then again, giving even a local government an idea is useless when big business lines their pockets with money. 

3 shot HDR, shot handheld with a Canon 7D. The flare was awesome, one of the best if not the best I've ever shot with this lens. Processed in Camera Raw to remove aberration, then merged to HDR and processed again in Camera Raw.

photos.name: Keepin' Christ In Christmas
photos.description: Happy Holidays everyone! This year we travelled up the California coast for Christmas to visit some friends in Humboldt. There were some lavish christmas light displays even in small rural communities that sparsely make up Humboldt. This family kept is simple though, only displaying a cross adorned with Christmas lights. This is the original crop. Shot this out the side of a moving car.

photos.name: Why I Love Subaru
photos.description: This photo pretty much encapsulates why I love Subaru, which sounds so cliche due to their marketing campaign in the states. After being pretty much born into a family that always owned a Subaru, these cars are just familiar to me. I learned to drive on my mother's 1992 Subaru Legacy wagon. I've been driving Subarus for 15 years now and in that timespan owned 2 used and 1 new. Subarus are extremely dependable cars, the engine with proper care will last longer than most other manufacturers. This is why when driving around the Pacific Northwest or Northeast you see a ton of Subarus. Well, that and the AWD makes driving in the snow easier. I've driven my Subaru's out of 1 foot of snow several times without shoveling. After owning a Legacy and Outbacks, I know a decent amount about their mechanics so it doesn't make sense for me to purchase any other brand at this point. I'll probably be behind the wheel of a Subaru for the rest of my life, whipping around the twists and turns of mountain roads.

photos.name: Sunrise On Route 1 In Mendo
photos.description: Just squeezing into the left side of frame you can see a car traveling north on Route 1 in Mendocino County one early December morning. The sky and the overall color was too good to pass up, so we stopped on the side of the road and snapped a few photos. Not framed particularly well, but it does the job.

photos.name: Sunrise On The Navarro River
photos.description: We woke up before the sun rose at our campsite in Mendocino County, California. After packing up camp, we continued our drive southbound on Route 1. The sunrise was dramatic and full of color. I had already shot a few photographs at this location a day before at sunset, it was just coincidence really that we pulled off at the same spot during sunrise. The color in the sky was beautiful and the reflection in the water compelling enough to capture this scene in HDR, 3 shots proposed in Camera Raw to remove aberration then merge to HDR in Photoshop CC, corrected using Camera Raw filter.

photos.name: Sailing At Sunset In The South Bay
photos.description: Captured this shot of a small sailboat pulling into the King Harbor Marina during an exquisite sunset here in Redondo Beach, CA. I just launched a new photo portfolio that I also developed at kineticlight.co. It will replace my 500px portfolio after my Awesome account expires. I really did not appreciate when 500px took down my portfolio after messaging only 5 of my followers links to my Kickstarter for my exhibition. They said I was spamming, which is not true. So I created this new website, that I hope you will visit and enjoy the experience on an iPad or iPhone. I can create photo portfolios for you too for a reasonable price. There will be a short break from abstract photography on my profile.

photos.name: Bombay Beach, CA
photos.description:
The desert town of Bombay Beach in California sits on the eastern shore of the Salton Sea, a very polluted and salty body of water. The town is protected from the rising water level of the Sea by this dyke. Since the town gets flooded every so often, townspeople have elected to abandon their homes during the worst of floods. Even the current dyke doesn't fully protect the town if water levels rise quickly. Some people still live here, amongst the rotting corpses of deserted homes. 

There are details in the pit not to be missed, including a tennis racket stuck in the mud. The town sits in the background, behind the dyke.

photos.name: North Shore
photos.description: The town of North Shore sits on the northeastern shore of the Salton Sea, a lake that is so polluted and has such a high concentration of salt that all the fish will be dead in our lifetime. The beach here is not sand, but instead the crumbled bones of fish. A group of birds hang out in the shallow water. The mountains fade into the distance.

photos.name: Out Of Gas
photos.description: An abandoned gas station in the middle of the desert southeast of Indio, California near the Sultan Sea.

photos.name: El Capitan Bathed in Sunlight
photos.description: El Capitan basking in late afternoon sunlight in Yosemite National Park.

photos.name: Vasquez Rocks By Twilight
photos.description: Vasquez Rocks in twilight. I hope to return to this spot at Twilight a few more times.

photos.name: Time Is Still On The Edge Of Forever
photos.description: I had some fun with this one. This is a composite of two shots from that day.

photos.name: Toliver Run
photos.description: Caught this shot of Toliver Run during an unusually warm winter day in Garrett County, MD. The lens flare points directly to and partially overpass a person on the rocks. This should be displayed large to see all the details. The lens flair in the 16-35mm f/4L IS USM is rather pleasing, I'm glad I forgot to pack the hood. The perfect spot to kayak in Western Maryland.

photos.name: An Icon By Accident
photos.description: The title is a play on words. The stars on this barn are mimicked on other homes on this stretch of road miles away from Deep Creek Lake in the town of Accident, Maryland. The sunset always dips below the mountain here, however this evening the sunlight spoked through some looming clouds that promised snow. This town in Garret County gets a disproportionate amount of snow compared to the rest of the state of Maryland. Incidentally, fog roams through these hills that are nestled in the middle of the Appalachian Mountains. It's funny to me "Accident" isn't even on the map.

photos.name: On The Farm Upstate
photos.description: Caught this shot of a farm in Upstate New York.

photos.name: Old Pickup Truck in Upstate New York
photos.description:
A lone old pickup truck barrels down the road in this snowy and foggy landscape in Upstate New York. 

I picked up a 16-35mm f/4L IS USM right before Christmas and spent the entire break shooting with this lens. I don't miss the extra 5mm on the telephoto end of my old 17-40mm f/4L USM. The 16-35mm f/4L IS USM weighs more, but paired with my 70-200mm f/4L IS USM I have a great pair of zooms to venture out with now. There is considerably less barrel distortion, vignetting, and higher resolution and even more sharpness than the 17-40mm f/4L.

photos.name: The Rain Is Gone
photos.description: The much needed rain was a non stop this past weekend until sunday evening when the sky opened up to reveal this beautiful sunset in Redondo Beach, California.

photos.name: Mono Lake
photos.description: Mono Lake in California.

photos.name: Autumn In The Cemetery
photos.description: This is where my abstract work bleeds into the landscapes I photograph. Taken while poking around Oakwood Cemetery in Troy, NY during the fall season. This is the original crop, although I flipped the shot vertically so the POV would make sense. This is a photograph of a reflection in one of the ponds in Oakwood Cemetery.

photos.name: Autumn Upstate
photos.description: Taken during a recent trip to Upstate New York in Oakwood Cemetery in Troy, NY. 3 shot HDR.

photos.name: Autumn At The Old Mill
photos.description: Caught this shot near Lake Lauderdale in Washington County in Upstate New York along the Batten Kill. The creeks are called kills in Upstate from the original Dutch settlers. This abandoned mill is next to the Rexleigh Covered Bridge. I imagine it operated at the turn of the 20th Century.  The mill stone was beside the building, cracked and decayed. Tomorrow I'll post a shot taken inside the place.

photos.name: Crossing The Covered Bridge
photos.description: We wandered onto the Rexleigh Covered Bridge outside of Cambridge, NY while we were visiting Upstate NY. Processed in Photoshop CC.

photos.name: Arizona II
photos.description: I'm going through a bunch of archived photos and found this alternative view of some mountains in the desert of Arizona. I got this photo while we were driving cross country with trailer in tow from Syracuse, NY to Los Angeles, CA. It was originally shot in color with 3 exposures +-2EV, processed in Camera Raw and Merge to HDR in Photoshop CS6, corrected some noise and then processed in Black and White Filter Adjustment. I crushed the blacks a bit and thought the contrast was stunning on the rocks and dead desert brush. You can really feel the distance to the mountain via the atmospheric perspective and DOF. I wish I could shoot infrared, sometimes.

photos.name: Cathedral Gorge
photos.description: Melting snow on the rim of Cathedral Gorge in Southeastern Nevada.

photos.name: There's Always Sun After the Rain
photos.description:
The cloudy skies broke at at the horizon on this day in Redondo Beach, offering this beautiful show of twilight colors. 

3 Shot HDR, processed 2 different ways and blended. I might do this technique for all the dark cloudy skies in my photos if ya'll like it.

photos.name: Thank You, Pioche
photos.description: Sun setting on the ole mining town Pioche, also the county seat of Lincoln County in Southeastern, Nevada.

photos.name: Anywhere, America II
photos.description: This photo is part of a series where I take a look at the state of the American Dream during the recession.

photos.name: Country Gold II
photos.description:
I decided to take the scenic route one afternoon and found this sunset in my rear view mirror. The countryside in Upstate New York is filled with rolling hills and farmlands. In the foothills of the Adirondacks, scenes like these can be viewed in the humid summer evening. Other shots had better crops, but this wide angle had the best sunburst and atmosphere in my opinion.

5 shot HDR, processed in PS HDR Pro. Uploaded again with different toning and processing, nicer composition. Looks more natural.

photos.name: Half Dome in the Distance
photos.description: While driving through Yosemite, I caught this shot of Half Dome from one of the parking areas. Planning a return trip to explore Yosemite in detail in 2013.

photos.name: Palos Verdes Sunset
photos.description:
Just after sunset, the rocks in the Palos Verdes Pennisula turn magnificent purples, blues, and reds. These are heavily eroded volcanic rocks. Beautiful boulders to climb around on. 

3 Shot HDR, tripod. 

Just after sunset at in a cove in Rancho Palos Verdes, CA just south of Los Angeles.

photos.name: Winter's Run
photos.description:
In summertime, the Los Angeles River is most dried up. Winter is a completely different story, where earthen bottom portions of the River become teaming with life. Most of the LA River is a hude concrete slab. Here, runoff water from the Los Angeles mountains makes it's final stretch into the Pacific. 

Birds bathe in this section of the L.A. River, as shot heading South from the Sepulveda Blvd. bridge. The Long Beach skyline is in the distance to the left, the Port of L.A. to the right. 

3 shot HDR, saturated and slight curves in Photoshop.

photos.name: Twilight on the Pennisula
photos.description: Just after sunset on Palos Verdes Pennisula. Jagged rocks, rocked by volcanic activity are now eroded away by natural forces. At twilight, the volcanic rocks turn all sorts of beautiful colors. Catalina Island sits off in the distance, while the southern tip of Palos Verdes Pennisula jets out into the top left of the frame.

photos.name: Sailing Out Of The Marina
photos.description:
Two sailboats pick up the strong winds on a Sunday afternoon in the King Harbor Marina in Redondo Beach, CA. Animals crowd the jetty, sunbathing on the rocks while the clouds move quickly above.

Single shot, processed with HDR in Photoshop and blended with original.

photos.name: The Desert Road Is My Home
photos.description: The open road of the desert in front of me, twisting and turning through the mountains before it comes to an endless expanse of desert flat. Taken somewhere in New Mexico, 3 shot HDR.

photos.name: Sunset at Honeymoon Cove
photos.description:
Sunset in Palos Verdes Estates in one of the more isolated coves, Honeymoon Cove. I thought the sunset was over, so I packed up my gear and turned around after hiking a bit to find the sun had lit up the sky again. Captured this along the trail among the beautiful volcanic rocks. I want to go back and find some different rocks that were from lava flows, because they looked amazing during sunset.

The last upload was cropped slightly differently in Photoshop, as to allow a silver of negative space on the bottom of the frame.

photos.name: Flowers Off The Angeles Crest Highway
photos.description: Caught this shot of some wildflowers on the side of a trail connecting two parking areas on the Angeles Crest Highway. It's summertime in Southern California and June Gloom has set in on the coast, so we decided this morning we needed some fresh mountain air. The lighting was flat most of the day, except for areas partially lit by some sunlight cutting through the tree line.

photos.name: Morning On The Farm in California
photos.description: Caught this shot in the early morning on a drive back from San Francisco to Los Angeles, CA somewhere close to Bakersfield, CA.3 shot HDR, processed in Camera Raw, Merge to HDR Pro, Reprocessed in Camera Raw and output to Progressive JPEG.

photos.name: Rocky Mountain Crescent
photos.description: Taken somewhere off the side of a mountain road in Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado. I like this horizontal composition, especially with the crescent moon.

photos.name: Golden Cove
photos.description:
This golden sunset lit up a band of clouds, the shimmering low tide reflecting the beautiful color of the bright California sky.

Shot at Lunada Bay in Rancho Palos Verdes. 3 shot HDR, processed in Photoshop.

photos.name: Erosion
photos.description:
Shot while on a hike in Cathedral Gorge State Park in NV.  3 shot HDR converted to B+W in CS6.

Thank you everyone for you support! Vote and fav my photos and I usually return the favor.

photos.name: The Gate
photos.description: The Gate to the Garden of the Gods, taken during my second trip to the park on a wonderfully cloudy day. This place has been photographed tons of times, so I hope this is a fresh take. I can imagine a God behind the Gate, with all the dark clouds looming in the sky behind the gate.

photos.name: Arizona
photos.description:
Caught this shot somewhere off the Interstate on a mountain road in Arizona. 

There's another color processed photo called "Desert Bliss" in my profile, but this B+W  really highlights the more interesting parts of this landscape.

photos.name: Autumn In Lake Taghkanic State Park
photos.description: On our drive down the Taconic State Parkway in Upstate New York we saw a sign for Lake Taghkanic State Park so we drove in to see what autumn was like at the Lake, which seems like it would be a preferred summertime destination for swimming. I crouched down on the shore to capture the lilypads in the foreground and managed to capture this 3 shot HDR handheld with a Canon 7D. I have a few other angles from this section of lake I will probably post in the next few days.

photos.name: Autumn Lake
photos.description: I liked the backlighting on the trees in this shot from Lake Taghkanic State Park in Upstate New York.

photos.name: Mono Lake
photos.description: Mono Lake in California.

photos.name: The Last Sun of 2012
photos.description:
Happy New Year!

I thought this shot would be appropriate for the last sunset of 2012. People were scared the world was going to end on the turning of the Mayan Calendar, so I wanted this shot to reflect the sense of a monolithic calendar formed by the pillars. I might study the movement of the sun through the pillars as the seasons change in 2013, try to get that sun in the center one day. This probably won't be the last shot of sunset at the pier.

 This was shot in Manhattan Beach below the pier on Dec 31st, 2012. 3 shot handheld HDR, +-3EV I think. Happy New Year everyone!

photos.name: Sunset at Honeymoon Cove
photos.description:
Sunset in Palos Verdes Estates in one of the more isolated coves, Honeymoon Cove. I thought the sunset was over, so I packed up my gear and turned around after hiking a bit to find the sun had lit up the sky again. Captured this along the trail among the beautiful volcanic rocks. photos.name: Graffiti Sunset
photos.description: Walking through Venice Beach, I caught this shot of a man admiring the graffiti walls on the beach. Venice Beach is a colorful town and tonight so was the sunset. Shot during the sunset at its peak, HDR +-2EV using Canon 7D.

photos.name: After A Satisfying Dive
photos.description: A diver collects his thoughts while gazing on the beautiful sunset in Redondo Beach, CA. Shot using Canon 7D with 3 exposure HDR, 2EV+- processing in Photoshop Camera Raw and HDR Pro.

photos.name: New Years Stroll on Manhattan Beach Pier
photos.description: Couples walking on Manhattan Beach Pier before sunset. Christmas decorations still up, the holiday season is almost over. New Years Eve on Manhattan Beach Pier. 3 shot handheld HDR, 3EV+- with Canon 7D.

photos.description:
Just after sunset, the rocks in the Palos Verdes Pennisula turn magnificent purples, blues, and reds. These are heavily eroded volcanic rocks. Beautiful boulders to climb around on.

Just after sunset at in a cove in Rancho Palos Verdes, CA just south of Los Angeles.

photos.description:
This golden sunset lit up a band of clouds, the shimmering low tide reflecting the beautiful color of the bright California sky.

Shot at Lunada Bay in Rancho Palos Verdes. 3 shot HDR, processed in Photoshop.

photos.name: The Eye Of God
photos.description: This is the first sunset I photographed in California after our road trip from the East Coast. Taken from the balcony of our hotel, I couldn't find a pleasing foreground so I popped open the telephoto and caught this shot of the sun near the horizon, ducking behind some beautiful clouds. It was very inspirational for me at the time.

photos.name: Sunset on Sunset
photos.description:
Sunset on Sunset Blvd. is magical sometimes. The old motel signs harken back to the days when this road was the end of the famous Route 66. 

Caught this shot while heading into a restaurant on Sunset Blvd. in Hollywood, CA. The perspective of the street and the lighting caught my eye. wish the woman walking had better movement and she does in the HDR, but this processed version of one of the shots came out way better.

photos.name: CAUTION: DO NOT ENTER
photos.description: Ran down to the beach at sunset and caught this shot on Memorial Day.

photos.name: Stray Sunset
photos.description:
I was out shooting this sunset at an overlook by Malaga Cove in Palos Verdes Estates, CA when this stray black kitten wandered by. He didn't actually cross my path and was very approachable, although I didn;t touch him. This was a very hungry kitten, I caught him stalking a Hummingbird. We wanted to save him, but can't! Please help this kitty!

This is a single exposure, processed in Photoshop Camera Raw, removed some noise from shooting at 1250 ISO, focus at infinity.

photos.description:
The cloudy skies broke at at the horizon on this day in Redondo Beach, offering this beautiful show of twilight colors. 

3 Shot HDR, processed 2 different ways and blended. I might do this technique for all the dark cloudy skies in my photos if ya'll like it.

photos.name: Twilight On The Edge Of The World
photos.description: Caught this shot of a California Sunset off the edge of a cliff on the Palos Verdes Peninsula, just south of Redondo Beach.

photos.name: Firefighters Racing To Redondo Beach Pier
photos.description: Caught this shot out of nowhere while walking down to the pier in Redondo Beach one evening.

photos.name: Vintage Cali
photos.description: Shot on the coast in Northern California. After editing in Photoshop CC it felt vintage to me. Considering moving over to Lightroom because the app is coming out for iPad, but really dig my current workflow in Photoshop CC so I may not abandon it just yet.

photos.name: Sunset In Redondo Beach
photos.description: Sunset in Redondo Beach, CA one January evening in 2014.

photos.name: One January Evening Off The Coast Of California
photos.description: Just as the title says, one evening this January the Santa Ana winds swept some clouds over the ocean.

photos.name: Lifeguard Off Duty
photos.description: A lifeguard in Redondo Beach, CA goes off duty, pictured here collecting the flags dispersed on the sand. The sun sets over the Pacific Ocean, retreating over the horizon to signal the end of another November day on the coast of California.

photos.name: That Last Glimpse Of Sunlight Is An Illusion
photos.description: Caught this fiery sunset in Redondo Beach, CA.

photos.name: The Sky Is Burning!
photos.description: A sunset in Redondo Beach, CA in December. This is a great time of year to watch the sunset in Southern California.

photos.name: Sailing Into The Inferno
photos.description: A lone sail boat sits still on the horizon, birds flying in the sky at the end of this glorious sunset off the coast of California.

photos.name: Running Into The Sunset
photos.description: A group of kids running through the frame of this sunset shot during the end of a beautiful December day in Redondo Beach, California. The Palos Verdes Peninsula stretches along the horizon into the burning embers of the sunset. I thought my 17-40mm f/4L was getting long in the tooth, but it is still pumping out some amazing shots.

photos.name: An Icon By Accident
photos.description: The title is a play on words. The stars on this barn are mimicked on other homes on this stretch of road miles away from Deep Creek Lake in the town of Accident, Maryland. The sunset always dips below the mountain here, however this evening the sunlight spoked through some looming clouds that promised snow. This town in Garret County gets a disproportionate amount of snow compared to the rest of the state of Maryland. Incidentally, fog roams through these hills that are nestled in the middle of the Appalachian Mountains. It's funny to me "Accident" isn't even on the map.

photos.name: The Rain Is Gone
photos.description: The much needed rain was a non stop this past weekend until sunday evening when the sky opened up to reveal this beautiful sunset in Redondo Beach, California.

photos.name: Greetings From Redondo Beach
photos.description:
Redondo Beach Pier on a Saturday in January. It was a nice sunny day today, bringing people down to Redondo Beach.

I wish Canon and other camera manufacturers would offer firmware upgrades with meaningful feature updates. At least for Canon users there is Magic Lantern. Today I turned on the Dual ISO module. ML directs the camera to take one shot where half the photo is ISO 100 and another is ISO 1600 for instance. The photo looks like it has scanlines before being processed in the cr2hdr app. Afterward, I brought the DNG created by the cr2hdr app into Camera Raw and process it further. The dynamic range is fantastic without having to postprocess in HDR. Often when putting shots of waves through a HDR process, ghosting is out of control resulting in strange fragments and noise. Dual ISO is a viable alternative to HDR, but the cr2hdr app is prone to create moire and noise in some instances so take multiple shots if you want to make sure you have a good one.

photos.name: Inside The Haunted Mill
photos.description: Outside of Cambridge, NY in the countryside of Upstate New York, an old abandoned mill sits on the shore of the Batten Kill. The locals seem to think the place is haunted. I like taking photos of abandoned buildings and used my friend Jared Landburg's amazing photography as inspiration for this photograph. I might return with a ladder and jump down into the main structure, I think theres a good opportunity for an excellent shot at sunrise.

photos.name: Sentinels
photos.description: On a recent trip to Albany, NY we stopped by Empire State Plaza and snapped a few photos. This one features most of the buildings in the plaza. I particularly liked the POV and minimal sky that contrasts the detail in the buildings.

photos.name: Paradise on Sunset
photos.description: A capture of the Paradise Motel on Sunset Blvd with light trails. The LA skyline rests in the background. Someone's waiting for the bus on the corner, while taxis stream in and out of the motel. I'm capturing shots of LA that hopefully are fresh and a little different.

photos.name: The Mall
photos.description:
This photo is part of a series where I analyze the state of the American Dream during the recession. Taken during the 2009 Holiday season at the Mall of America, this photo shows how even at the most popular mall in the country had fewer people spending at Chrismas than usual.

I really enjoy the sharpness of this photograph provided by the 17-40mm f/4L lens. I focused on the the couple pushing a stroller on the lower level.

photos.name: L.A.
photos.description: I live in Los Angeles and where I live I photograph.You can see the smog that grips downtown practically everyday. This was taken around Culver City during the usual morning commute. HDR, 3 exposures.

photos.name: 2:30 in manhattan beach
photos.description: Beach goers in Manhattan Beach, CA still enjoy the late July day despite cloudy skies. A few guys throw around a football, while a child walks from left to right near the center of the frame. The a large column holding up the pier is directly placed on the right third of the photo, the cones create a diagonal, while the beach houses round out the composition as they appear to endlessly recede into the background. Stunning clarity due to HDR processing and one of the sharpest lenses Canon offers, the EF 17-40mm f/4L at f/16 giving up an incredible field of view.

photos.name: Beach Condos
photos.description: Beach condos in Redondo Beach, their conflicting architecture creates interesting geometric compositions. Shot at night with Canon 7D, EF 50mm f/1.4 USM  1/13" f/1.4 1600 ISO. Gets a bit grainy.

photos.name: City of Industry
photos.description: Trains recede into the horizon, a vacant parking lot sits to the right while a bustling enterprise in the top left calls its workers back from Christmas break. Shot from an overpass in Torrance, CA. HDR composite from 3 exposures using the Canon 17-40mm f/4L.

photos.name: New Years Stroll on Manhattan Beach Pier
photos.description: Couples walking on Manhattan Beach Pier before sunset. Christmas decorations still up, the holiday season is almost over. New Years Eve on Manhattan Beach Pier. 3 shot handheld HDR, 3EV+- with Canon 7D.

photos.name: Fish Fight!
photos.description:
Two pelicans fight over a fish while other pelicans sit docile waiting for fishermen on Redondo Beach Pier to drop their bait. 

This photo is part fo series where I document the Beach Cities I live in. This shot was taken on a brisk winter sunday afternoon in Redondo Beach, CA.

photos.name: Happy New Years from Venice Beach!
photos.description: Happy New Years! The entrance to Venice Beach, during the holidays. After sunset in Venice Beach, CA

photos.name: Graffiti Sunset
photos.description: Walking through Venice Beach, I caught this shot of a man admiring the graffiti walls on the beach. Venice Beach is a colorful town and tonight so was the sunset. Shot during the sunset at its peak, HDR +-2EV using Canon 7D.

photos.name: Fishermen on Redondo Pier
photos.description:
Caught this portrait of fishermen washing the catch of the day on the Redondo Pier. This is typical life down on the pier in Redondo Beach on a sunny day.

This is part of a series where I photograph the beach cities I live in.

photos.name: Pulling Into Dock
photos.description: A boat pulling into dock in Marina Del Rey, CA on New Years Day.

photos.name: Waiting For Donuts
photos.description: Waiting in line is just a fact of life in Los Angeles, as this queue for a late night snack at Randy's Donuts near LAX demonstrates. Randy's Donuts is a bit of a landmark in Los Angeles and for good reason, it's a gigantic donut on the side of the road. Donuts are a staple in LA and this place has some of the tastiest donuts in town.

photos.name: Sunset In Redondo Beach
photos.description:
This photo is part of a series where I document the Beach Cities of Los Angeles, the place I live. Redondo Beach is a pleasant, family oriented beach community. A group of teens ask the lifeguard how much he gets paid, to which he replied "enough". The sun sets in the background, the end to a pleasant March day at the beach.

3 shot HDR, tonemapped and processed in Camera Raw, Photoshop HDR Pro.

photos.name: Winter's Run
photos.description:
In summertime, the Los Angeles River is most dried up. Winter is a completely different story, where earthen bottom portions of the River become teaming with life. Most of the LA River is a hude concrete slab. Here, runoff water from the Los Angeles mountains makes it's final stretch into the Pacific. 

Birds bathe in this section of the L.A. River, as shot heading South from the Sepulveda Blvd. bridge. The Long Beach skyline is in the distance to the left, the Port of L.A. to the right. 

3 shot HDR, saturated and slight curves in Photoshop.

photos.name: Sunset on Sunset
photos.description:
Sunset on Sunset Blvd. is magical sometimes. The old motel signs harken back to the days when this road was the end of the famous Route 66. 

Caught this shot while heading into a restaurant on Sunset Blvd. in Hollywood, CA. The perspective of the street and the lighting caught my eye. wish the woman walking had better movement and she does in the HDR, but this processed version of one of the shots came out way better.

photos.name: Big Box
photos.description:
This photo is part of a series of images where I am documenting the state of the American Dream in American during the latest recession. I shot this at a vacant Bog Box store somewhere in Arizona while driving cross country. This particular photo is probably a familiar scene in many rural communities in the U.S.A. Sometimes people repurpose these structures into community centers, churches, art centers, but this one was vacant when I happened upon it. I thought it was odd a light was missing.

3 shot HDR shot shot on a tripod w/ Canon 7D, processed in Camera Raw to remove distortion from 17-40mm f/4L, then Merge to HDR Pro and that was it. I like the color contrast and detail in the structure, and the overall tone of the lighting. What do you like about it?

This photo has been recently reprocessed for a submission to an exhibition.

photos.name: CAUTION: DO NOT ENTER
photos.description: Ran down to the beach at sunset and caught this shot on Memorial Day.

photos.name: Running On The Beach In San Francisco
photos.description: On a recent trip we dropped into San Francisco for a day, went to Baker Beach for part of the late afternoon. Caught this shot of other people enjoying the beach with the Golden Gate Bridge in the background. I was fortunate to have some amazing lighting as the sun dropped beneath a hazy mass of clouds. 3 Shot HDR shot handheld with Canon 7D, processed in Camera Raw to remove distortion, Merge to HDR in Photoshop, reprocessed in Camera Raw with the new filter in Photoshop CC to make adjustments post HDR, then exported to JPG. This shot is a lot like a previous beach shot in L.A. I posted almost a year ago called The Dude. The person in the center pops against the perspective created by the beach, the Golden Gate Bridge rests on a third. The shoes reinforce the perspective. I like this one because it works compositionally.

photos.name: The Streets Are Busy In Troy
photos.description:
Troy, NY is experiencing a revival of sorts right now. Property values are going up post recession, artists from Brooklyn are moving into town. In the past couple years, Troy, NY commissioned some artists to create statues of Uncle Sam, who was native to the city. He is buried in Oakwood Cemetery nearby and lived close to Prospect Park in Troy. Each Uncle Sam statue is different. This one allows anyone to write on it. There are 18 or more of the statues around the city now. Recently, a vandal started decapitating the statues but he was caught. Troy, NY is a river town in Upstate New York in the Albany Capitol Region. The city sits on the Hudson River. 

This photo is part of a series of photographs taken in the Albany Capitol Region during a recent trip there in Autumn of 2013. I had a few selects for this shot, but chose this one for the perspective, the contrast between the Uncle Sam statue and the man and overall color and tone.  3 shot HDR processed in Photoshop CC.

photos.name: Sentinels II
photos.description:
Everyone remembers the World Trade Center Twin Towers from before the 9/11 terrorist attacks on NY. Not everyone is aware of the still standing Empire State Plaza in Albany, NY. The buildings there have the same architectural look and feel as the former Twin Towers, except what sets these towers apart is their heavy use of marble. 

This shot is like one I posted earlier, but in my initial edit I didn't realize this one had a much better exposure which revealed the cloudy sky. 3 shot HDR, processed in Camera Raw.

photos.name: Memorial
photos.description: The Missing Persons Memorial adjacent to Empire State Plaza on Madison Avenue in Albany, NY.

photos.name: Corporate America II
photos.description: Captured this toward the end of a weekday at the office where I work. The sunlight that bounces off the corporate architecture next door is mesmerizing some evenings.

photos.name: Public Library At Sunset
photos.description: The old public library in Redondo Beach is now rented out for weddings and celebrations of the sort. The library is situated on a hill overlooking the beach and pier.

photos.name: Down And Out In Fort Bragg
photos.description: Woke up one morning in a hotel in Fort Bragg to this incredible sunrise that lit up the foggy marine layer in the bay. Right outside the hotel were a few interesting cars that had been painted. I thought this scene summed up the character of the town in Mendocino County.

photos.name: Corporate America IV
photos.description: This shot is the last in a series of photos where I am trying to capture the look of "corporate america".

photos.name: Warehouse District At Dusk
photos.description: Captured this HDR somewhere off the 10 in Southern California right before we ate some delicious Mexican food. I like the details in the backlit wire, both electrical and barbed.

photos.name: Praise Waiteth for Thee O God in Zion
photos.description: A deserted church in the middle of nowhere in California.
